intro: Pedicularis myriophylla var. purpurea, commonly known as the purple leaved lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often with a distinctive hooded structure. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
